frameDefinitions: This frame deals with a Speaker communicating a reply or response, a Message, to some prior communication or action, the Trigger.  ''
An Agent displays a Characteristic of a Standard in his or her own way of behaving.
This frame concerns a specific subset of Instances of a Type which are evaluated in terms of their similarity to a conceptual prototype of the Type.
Two or more distinct entities, which may be concrete or abstract objects or types, are characterized as being similar to each other.
This frame involves a Creator making a duplicate, the Copy, of some Original entity.
A Fugitive avoids recapture by or on the authority of Authorities in relation to a Crime which the Fugitive has committed or is suspected of having committed.
frameExamples: The landlord has not yet <t>replied</t> in writing to the tenant objecting the proposed alterations.DNI
I guessed he was trying to <t>imitate</t> the movements of a skier

A mulberry is very <t>similar</t> in shape
to a loganberry
The teacher <t>copied</t> the problem onto the blackboard.
He is in fact a <t>fugitive</t> of the law and you must inform the police if you see him.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity that communicates the reply or response. It is expressed as the External Argument of predicative uses of a <t>Target</t> verb or as the Genitive modifier of a <t>Target</t> noun:
This is the person to whom the response is communicated.  When expressed, this role occurs as the direct object of a <t>Target</t> verb, or in a prepositional phrase introduced by 'to':
The <fen>Message</fen> is the role that identifies the content of what the <fen>Speaker</fen> is communicating to the <fen>Addressee</fen>. It can be expressed as a direct quote or a clause.
<fen>Topic</fen> occurs quite rarely in this frame and usually only as a PP Complement of a noun <t>Target</t>:
The <fen>Trigger</fen> is the prior communication or action to which a response is given. It can occur as an NP Object or a PP Complement.
The time interval during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes their verbal response.
The location in which the <fen>Speaker</fen>  makes a verbal response.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person that borrows a <fen>Characteristic</fen> behavior from a <fen>Standard</fen>.
The <fen>Characteristic</fen> is a behavior or property that the <fen>Standard</fen> possesses and which the <fen>Agent</fen> adopts in his or her own behavior.
The <fen>Standard</fen> is the entity that exhibits a certain <fen>Characteristic</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> models their own behavior on.
The time at which the imitation occurs.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> imitates some entity which acts as a <fen>Standard</fen>.
A thing or episode that is considered exemplary of a certain <fen>Type</fen>.
The category of things or events from which an <fen>Instance</fen> is picked out.
This role marks constituents that express the set of objects or types whose similarity is at issue.

When there is an asymmetry, <fen>Entity_1</fen> is the entity characterized by its similarity to <fen>Entity_2</fen>, whose characteristics are assumed to be known.  <fen>Entity_1</fen> is often an external argument.

When the <fen>Entities</fen> are expressed separately, <fen>Entity_2</fen> is the one whose characteristics are assumed to be known; it serves as a basis for establishing characteristics of <fen>Entity_1</fen>.
This role marks constituents which express a property in respect to which the similarity of the entities is assessed.
A fact about <fen>Entity_1</fen> or the <fen>Entities</fen> that reveals how <fen>Entity_1</fen> is the same or different from other entities.  (Note the contrast with 'as to'.)
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the similarity occurs or exists.
The Place is the general area in which similarity occurs or exists
The <fen>Creator</fen> produces the <fen>Copy</fen> based on the <fen>Original</fen>.  It is normally expressed as an External Argument.
The <fen>Original</fen> is the entity which is copied. With verbs it is frequently expressed as an NP Object:
The <fen>Copy</fen> produced by the <fen>Creator</fen> is frequently not expressed. However, when <fen>Copy</fen> does occur, it is usually expressed as the External Argument of verbs:
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes <fen>Place</fen>.
The <fen>Fugitive</fen> has escaped and/or is evading capture by law enforcement <fen>Authorities</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Fugitive</fen> is evading law enforcement.
This role identifies the general <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Fugitive</fen> is located.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Sue</fex> responded to the objection convincingly.
Sue answered <fex>Bob</fex> immediately.
<fex>'I can't help you,'</fex> Sue answered.
My boss still hasn't given me an answer <fex>about a promotion</fex>.
Sue answered <fex>the question</fex>.
A reminder letter was sent to all nonrespondents who had not replied <fex>after 28 days</fex>.
This was how Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Jayalalithaa responded <fex>in the Assembly</fex> on November 5, 2003.
Mimic Snotlings do n't really think for themselves, <fex>they</fex> merely mimic the actions of Orcs and Goblins around them.
They were all mimicking <fex>my accent</fex>.
The singer says Gwen has copied <fex>her</fex> in many different ways.
<fex>The two painters</fex> were alike in being unable to draw acceptably .
In the first phase <fex>Barthes's approach</fex> has similarities to that of Levi-Strauss.
The results of Method 2 show remarkable similarity <fex>to those obtained by Method 1</fex>
The disc announced Friday is <fex>physically</fex> similar to current music CDs
His presidency was different <fex>in that it offered a way forward for the common man</fex> .
<fex>Pat</fex> photocopied the article.
Pat photocopied <fex>the article</fex>.
<fex>The results</fex> replicate those of an earlier study.
Only two years earlier <fex>she</fex> had been on the lam from charges of embezzlement.
He was a fugitive <fex>in the early 1990s</fex>.
Sloan, on the lam <fex>in Michigan</fex> for the last five months, is due to appear in court this Monday.
